Still one of the finest, smartest and most engaging games ever made. Though it has been with us for over 8 years, Portal 2 stands up, and remains the archetype for games such as the Talos Principal, The Turing Test and CUBE. Unlike many games of its generation, Portal 2's graphics have aged pretty well, though of course with Portal, the graphics aren't really the point. This game is primarily about solving puzzles, and thanks to the many Portal 2 devotees in the Steam Workshop there is an ever expanding supply, many of which are brilliantly inventive in their own way. The story is excellent, the coop is extremely well executed, and the voice acting is unparalleled in video games history (by which I mean that this is the only video game with Steve Merchant in it.) If you don't already own this game and you like to think of yourself as an intelligent and analytical personality then you must buy it. You can play it forever.
